info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 02 at 3:55AM PST until December 02 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 4000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...The Klamath Basin in central Klamath County. This includes Highway 97 from Chiloquin northwards. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
